sentences.sContent: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.sCn: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.sContent: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.sCn: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.sContent: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.sCn: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.sContent: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.sCn: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车
把这些书用快递寄出去。

sentences.sContent: ...Dear teacher，I am writing to express my appreciation for the generous help you rendered to me since I entered this university...
...I am writing to express my heartfelt gratitude for the continuous assistance you and your family have offered to me these years...
...I take this opportunity to express our deep appreciation for the kind assistance you rendered me...
....China could overtake the United States as the world's largest express market...
...the expansion of express industry is not surprising at all...
...Perhaps this group would be able to express clearly some benefits of the new technology that the more cautious doctors weren't ready to address...
...perhaps explaining why tears communicate states of mind and feelings that are often so difficult to express in words...
...Learning to express ideas well in both writing and speech...
...Boys' schools are the perfect place to teach young men to express their emotions and involve them in activities such as art...

phrases.pCn: 美国运通（财富500强公司之一，总部所在地美国）
表达自己的思想；表现自我
明示或默示；明订或默示
美国人民捷运航空公司
联邦快递，美国联邦快递公司

words.tran: 表现的；有表现力的；表达…的
清楚地，明显地；特别地，专门地
表现地；意味深长地；表示地
表达，表示；表情；表现力；措辞

trans.tranOther: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly
